p: Several studies examined the mental health impacts of flooding. An Australian study qualitatively explored individualsâ€™ experiences from rural communities, concluding that the threat of drought and flood are intertwined and contributed to decreased well-being from stress, anxiety, loss, and fear [ 42]. A cohort study from the UK looking at the long-term impact of flooding found psychological morbidity persisted for at least three years after the flooding event [ 43].
